Role Definitions

The goal of this document is to provide a working definition of responsibilities in the product development process for Vets.gov

Chief Technology Officer (VA)

The Chief Technology Officer layouts target architecture for implementing the policy and achieving the desired customer experience goals across infrastructure, applications and products. The CTO works with the Delivery Teams to discuss and analyze technology alternatives, and provide guidance and oversight to development activities.

Product Strategy (DSVA)

Product Strategists are responsible for the management, prioritization and sign-off of the product strategy and products we're building. Supported by the entire product developemt team, the product strategist is responsible for:

  • Defining the product strategy and requirements that detail what we're building.
  • Defining the initiatives and builds the product roadmap.
  • Defining and prioritizes the product backlog of epics and sets clear acceptance criteria.
  • Defining product milestones which are a collection of epics.
  • Determining when a potentially shippable product is ready to ship.

Product Design (DSVA + Contractor)

Product designers partner with product strategists to define the product and create the epic backlog. Most proudct designers are focused on describing the user experience via interaction designs, visual designs or information architecture. Supported by the entire product developemt team, the product designers responsibilities include:

  • Owning product design
  • Leading product exploration
  • Ensuring usability & 508 compliant
  • Verifying that designs are implemented according to spec

Product Engineering (DSVA)

While the product strategists and designers are responsible for defining the solution, the product engineering team knows best whatâ€™s technical possible. Supported by the entire product developemt team the product engineering team is responsible for:

  • Leading infrastructure decisions
  • Defining technology standards
  • Owning security processes
  • Defining release strategy

Product Delivery Owners (Contractor)

While product strategists, deisgns and engineers are concerned with what and how we should build things, product delivery owners are responsible for keeping track of how / when delivery teams are building it. There is a lot of coordination with the entire delivery team but key responsibilities are:

  • Breaks down epics to determine the goals and user stories for a sprint.
  • Works directly with the delivery teams to identify and raise blockers.
  • Provides status of progress towards epics and milestones through Zenhub and Github.
  • Ensures that the product roadmap reflects reality and current status.
  • Documents key product decisions in confluence that require information and input from a diverse group of VA stakeholders to be made.
  • Tracks progress/resolution to those decisions.

Product Delivery Teams (Contractor)

Product delivery teams are responsible building and deliverying the product. Cross-functionality in nature, these teams focus on product design, development, and delivery according to the feature and maintenance prioiritization set forth by the product delivery manager. Typically a delivery team will include the following:

  • A Tech Lead
  • A Scrum Master (who may or may not also be the tech lead)
  • One or more Front End Engineers (or a full stack engineer)
  • One or more Back End Engineers (or a full stack engineer)
  • One or more Designers

Additional roles may be permanently assiged to a team depending on the needs of the team (e.g. a content-heavy team may have a content writer permanently assigned to them).

Product Marketing & Communications (DSVA)

Product marketing and communications is focused on ensuring that Vets.gov is using and sharing the right messages for the right audiences. Product Marketing and communications people work with the product strategists to:

  • Define the value prop of Vets.gov

  • Create key messages for all features / functionality

  • Work with key VA communication stakeholders to market and share information about new features / functionalitu

Leads (DSVA + Contractor)

Each functional area, e.g. Content, Design, Engineering, Product Management, has a designated Lead. This group coordinates team-wide activities and resolves any blockers that make defining and launching the product possible.
